alert.note: Alert for Ozark; Taney (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 11 at 11:17PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Ozark and southeastern Taney Counties through MIDNIGHT CST... At 1117 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Diamond City to near Willis to near Clark Hill to near Valley Springs. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bull Shoals Lake, Gainesville, Theodosia, Pontiac, Sundown, Protem, Rueter, Willhoit, Long Run and Isabella. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
